entry.title: The Smell
entry.content:
Today Iâ€™m going to tell some stories about the smell.

I remember last fall there was a walkathon fundraising event in the company, and my colleagues and I registered for it. It was a night walk in Ditan park. When I walked through the park towards the north gate, I smelt a different air: There was no street light in the parkâ€”I could barely see the surroundings.

But in the twilight, walking along the footpath, on my right hand, the old, dark red city wall quietly standing besides me, on the left hand, in the distance, several people were talking and ready for the night walk. And along the footpath, all above me and surrounded me, were pine trees. That different smell of air was the smell of the pine trees. That smell was so adorable and natural, and I even couldnâ€™t move a step. Those days I was busy for a lot of things: working, band practicing, hanging out with friends, hardly have time to get along with myself. And at that moment, in that smell of pine trees with myself, I just hope that smell and feeling would last forever.

In the TV series , there is also a scene impressed me a lot. A man called Murphy and his best friend Lea, which becomes his girlfriend later, were going together for the first time. they were driving through a forest. Lea said: â€˜you know I remember every important thing that has ever happened to me, based on what song I was listening to at that time.â€™ Murphy said: â€˜I remember smells. Like our parking garage smells like fabric softener, and when my brother died it smelled like burnt foodâ€™. Lea asked: â€˜what are you smelling right now?â€™ Murphy turned his head out the window for a while and said: â€˜Pine trees.â€™ At that time, they were sitting in Leaâ€™s grandfatherâ€™s red vintage car, driving through a pine forest. It was a bright summer, and I think Murphy would never forget that smell.

Another story goes back to the first time that I was traveling alone 4 years ago. At that time, I was studying abroad, and decided to travel to Estonia and Latvia, these two countries I have never heard before. To save money, I choose a hostel. It was hard to find the place of that hostel, I arrived in the afternoon, the sun was bright outside, but the doorway was quite dark and cold, seems like something strange would happen in the thrilling movie. Walking in the hall, a cold reception poked his head out of the tiny window, and I paid 9 euros for one night, and got a key for my bed. Walking in the hostel was like walking in a maze. The corridor was narrow and dark, and quiet. I walk through the rooms along the way, and there seems no one in that building. I finally found my bed. There was no roommate in that room yet, all my attention was focused on the closet. The big, tall, dark yellow closet, with a large mirror embed in it. I was suddenly afraid of something strange would reflect on the mirror, or someone would hide in the closet. But I cannot scare myself, because it seems I have no roommate today, if there wasnâ€™t another person hidden in the closet.

I put my luggage away and took a new lipstick from my bag. I havenâ€™t used that lipstick before. Unscrew the lid and I tried it on. It smells like plum, sweet, a little bit tart and sour, and fresh. I wear the lipstick the whole day, wondering around the city, alone. After the travelling, out of nowhere I havenâ€™t used that lipstick for a long while. While half a year later, when I open that lipstick for the second time, I suddenly remember something. I smell that tart fresh smell of plum, my mind suddenly went back to the time in Estonia, the first solo travelling, that huge closet in the quiet hostel, the first smell of plum-liked lipstick, and those curious but a little scared mementos.

I remember the smell, a shampoo brand which my ex-boyfriend always use, after breaking up I had never bought it for years; I remember the smell, the smell like sweet mothball in my hometown, every time I went back home that was the first smell. I remember the smell of Osmanthus flower, that was last year I live with my boyfriend for a couple of month, at night we walk along the alley at night and at the end there was an Osmanthus tree.

The other day, it was a sunny morning. After a week of quarantine, I went out for the first time. I see the fresh blooming flowers, I hear the noisy sparrow, I smell the grass and earth, and I smelt spring coming.
entry.summary:
Today Iâ€™m going to tell some stories about the smell.

I remember last fall there was a walkathon fundraising event in the company, and my colleagues and I registered for it. It was a night walk in Ditan park. When I walked through the park towards the north gate, I smelt a different air: There was no street light in the parkâ€”I could barely see the surroundings.

ä¹æœˆ

ä¹æœˆçš„ä¸»é¢˜åº”è¯¥æ˜¯æ–­èˆç¦»ä¸é›¶æµªè´¹ã€‚è¿™ä¸ªæœˆé‡Œæˆ‘å°è¯•äº†å¾ˆå¤šå¾ˆå¤šæ–­èˆç¦»å’Œé›¶æµªè´¹çš„æ–¹æ³•ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”å¸Œæœ›è‡ªå·±ä¸€ç›´ä¸€ç›´åšä¸‹å»ï¼Œè®¤æ¸…è‡ªå·±éœ€è¦çš„ä¸œè¥¿ï¼Œè€Œä¸æ˜¯åº”è¯¥éœ€è¦çš„ä¸œè¥¿ã€‚ä¹æœˆçš„æœ«å°¾æ¬äº†å®¶ï¼Œå’Œæ–°ç”Ÿæ´»say helloã€‚æˆ‘å½»åº•æ‘†è„±äº†ä¸‰ä¸ªæœˆå‰ç°æš—çš„ã€åœæ»ä¸å‰çš„ç”Ÿæ´»ã€‚

åä¸€æœˆ

åä¸€æœˆçš„å¼€å¤´å’ŒäºäºŒç‹—å»å¬äº†Rachaelçš„liveï¼šè¿™æ˜¯ä¸€åœºæˆ‘é¢„è°‹å¥½ä¹…çš„liveï¼Œæœ€å–œæ¬¢çš„å¤–å›½å¥³æ­Œæ‰‹ï¼Œæ¼”å”±ä¼šçš„æœ€åç«Ÿå”±äº†é‚£é¦–<Sunday Afternoon>,é‚£æ®µæ—¶é—´æœ€å–œæ¬¢çš„ä¸€é¦–æ­Œã€‚æœ‰äººåœ¨ä¸‹é¢å–Šâ€œyou saved meâ€ã€‚

åä¸€æœˆä¹Ÿåšå®Œäº†åŠ¨æ€åŸºçº¿çš„é¡¹ç›®ï¼Œåœ¨å…¬å¸è·Ÿæˆˆå“¥ä»–ä»¬å‘†äº†å¾ˆå¤šå¤©ï¼Œåšå®Œäº†è®©è‹—è€æ¿è¡¨æ‰¬çš„Presentation,è·ŸäºäºŒç‹—å»è¯•äº†ç©ºä¸­ç‘œä¼½ï¼Œæœ«å°¾åˆå»äº†æ¾³é—¨å‡ºå·®ï¼Œè·Ÿé˜¿ä¿Šå’Œmingjieè®²äº†å¾ˆå¤šå¾ˆå¤šè¯ï¼Œå‘ç°äººä¸è®ºåˆ°äº†ä»€ä¹ˆå¹´çºªï¼Œæ‰“å¼€å¿ƒæ‰‰çš„æ—¶å€™éƒ½æ˜¯ä¸è‡ªä¿¡ä¸”å­©å­æ°”çš„ï¼›æ¾³é—¨çš„å‘¨æœ«zhuozhuoä»æ·±åœ³è¿‡æ¥ä¸€èµ·ç©ï¼Œåˆä¸€èµ·å›äº†æ·±åœ³ã€‚

åä¸€æœˆçš„æœ«å°¾ä¹Ÿäº¤äº†å¦ä¸€ä¸ªå¥½æœ‹å‹é˜Ÿé•¿ï¼Œå¼€å¿ƒå¹¶å¹¸è¿ã€‚

alter ego perfecto.

è¿™ä¸€å¹´çš„ä¸»é¢˜ç»™è‡ªå·±å®šä¸ºProductivity & Hack the Habits.

ä»å·¥ä½œä»¥æ¥çš„ç»å†çœ‹ï¼Œæˆ‘æ„Ÿå…´è¶£çš„ä¸€ç›´åœ¨äºBIç›¸å…³å¼€å‘ï¼Œå‡ ä¸ªæœˆæ¥è®©æˆ‘å­¦ä¹ AD,System Centerå„ç§è½¯ä»¶çš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œæ€»æ˜¯æ²¡æœ‰é‚£ä¹ˆæœ‰åŠ¨åŠ›ï¼›è€Œåœ¨åšæ•°æ®ç›¸å…³å·¥ä½œçš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œæ€»æ˜¯å–œæ¬¢è‡ªæ„¿åŠ ç­ï¼Œå¿«å¿«å®Œæˆã€‚åœ¨å­¦ç”Ÿæ—¶ä»£æˆ‘åšè¿‡å„ç§å„æ ·çš„å°è¯•ï¼Œé‚£äº›å°è¯•éƒ½æ²¡æœ‰ç»™æˆ‘è¿‡è¿™æ ·çš„æ„Ÿè§‰ã€‚

Responsibilities

Data Scientist in London, Other, United Kingdom | Engineering at MicrosoftJob details | Microsoft Careers

Consult with stakeholders across the organisation to design, run and evaluate experiments (ABn, multivariate test etc.)

Conduct in-depth analysis on huge datasets, and present rich and actionable insights that enables a data-lead product cycle

Research novel statistical approaches to ensure we are using the cutting-edge techniques to analyse our data

Develop and deploy machine learning models powering intelligence product features

Create compelling dashboards that improve teamâ€™s self-serve capability

Educate internal customers on data insights and promote data-driven culture

Design innovative metrics that reflect immediate and long-term impacts on user experience

Qualifications

â€¯Weâ€™d like to hear from you if you

Value diversity and inclusivity in the workplaceâ€¯â€¯

Are empathetic and eager to work collaboratively with your teamâ€¯â€¯

Have 3+ years of experience as data scientist designing, running and evaluating experiments

Are proficient in data wrangling using SQL and big data frameworks

Have 3+ years of programming experience with Python or R and relevant statistical packages

Have a relevant degree (e.g. Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering) or equivalent industry experienceâ€¯

Ability to communicate quantitative data insights efficiently and articulate how they will impact user experience

Have good understanding of statistics, data science and machine learning disciplines

Are comfortable with working in agile environments

Desirable but not required skills:â€¯

Experience in Apache Spark

Knowledge about cloud infrastructure Azure or AWS

Commercial experience in product analytics or growth analytics

Proficiency in data visualisation tools and frameworks

Experience in NLP

MSc or PhD in quantitative fields

Knowledge of major AI/deep learning frameworks Tensorflow/Pytorch

Responsibilities

The Data Science team within Visual Studio brings the unique IQ of understanding data through statistical techniques and building systems using cutting-edge machine learning algorithms at scale. The scientists closely work with business to design and develop novel AI solutions. They also work toward gathering deep insights and help in making data-driven business decisions.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics

2+ years development skills in Python, C#, C++ or Java.

Preferred Qualifications:

Masters or PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics, or related fields (undergraduates with significant appropriate experience will be considered).

Strong academic work and professional experience in statistics, machine learning, including deep learning, NLP, econometrics.

Experience in building cloud-scale systems and experience working with open source stacks for data processing and data science is desirable.

Excellent communication skills, ability to present and write reports, strong teamwork and collaboration skills.

entry.title: Protege
entry.content:
Topic: mentoring

I think most of you, whether in the Toastmaster Club, or in your workplace, you have had a mentor. And you must have the experience that you compare your mentor with others. â€œYour mentor seems better than mine.â€ Or â€œI think my mentor didnâ€™t teach me anything.â€ Do you care whether your mentor really teach you something or not? Yes, I think everyone cares. And have you ever thought about: What is the first thing come to your mind when talking about your mentor? I am not always a good mentee in my life, but I would like to share you some stories.

My physics teacher in the middle school was my first informal mentor. We lived in the neighborhood and went to school together every morning. So, this 30-minute walk became our mentoring time. You know she is diligent and accountable for her students. But on the way to school, she never talked about my study but always mentioned her feelings towards the world and her lovely daughter. Once it snows heavily, and the snow almost reached to my ankles. There were no vehicles, even no people along the road. The world was all white. Looking at the long, endless but bright way, and she said, I love this, you can just go straight forward, keep straight on, and never look back. Promise me, go straight and never look back. Even they call your name, never look back.

At that time, I had no idea what she was talking about. I just know if someone call me from behind, I will not look back. But as I grew older, when I miss the opportunity of an important project, when my ex-boyfriend cheated on me and I was disappointed with love, when I walk alone on the street at midnight but without money to take a taxi, I always remember the word. Keep straight on and never look back.

Sometimes you have this kind of mentor that really teach you, but you probably have a mentor that is not a typical good one.

My second mentorâ€™s name is Morgan. He was my mentor when I was an intern in a software company. He is not a mentor that we usually like: He didnâ€™t taught me any technical skills, he does not care about work, in the morning he showed up at 10 at customer site, and at noon he would hang out in the garden and back at 3 oâ€™clock. Once Morgan took me to â€˜jindingxuanâ€™ for lunch and recommend me â€˜niuza mixainâ€™. That dish was delicious. I told him Iâ€™ve never had better noodles like this. After lunch we went to the Starbucks for coffee. Morgan said, not everyone loves his work, and sometimes working is not all about your life. For example, today, after work in the evening, what do you remember? I think itâ€™s that bowl of â€˜niuza mixianâ€™. That conversation gave me a new view of how I treat my life. Since then sometimes before sleep I will ask myself what is the most valuable part in the day? Gradually I learnt to relax myself: it might be a cup of juice at midnight, or a guitar class at the weekend. From then on, I started to enjoy being an ordinary person. You know it hard to admit that you are ordinary. Before, I was the top student at school, I thought I am unique in the world, I thought I am special for others. After that, I think I am just unique to myself.

I cannot remember anything he taught me about work, but I always remember that bowl of â€˜niuza mixianâ€™.

I canâ€™t say what defines an excellent mentor, I canâ€™t say how to be an excellent mentee, but you should know, eventually it is you to decide what to get from your mentor. You learn knowledge from him, you can find what your life can be from his life, and above all, you might be enlighten by his word in one moment. But all of these should be explored by yourself, thatâ€™s not your mentorâ€™s obligation. It might be the case that my physics teacher didnâ€™t mean to tell me not to â€œlook backâ€ in my whole life, and it also might not be the case that Morgan meant to told me everyone is just unique to himself. But, after all, it is you who decides what your mentor can offer you, and it is you to enlighten your life by yourself.
entry.summary:
Topic: mentoring

I think most of you, whether in the Toastmaster Club, or in your workplace, you have had a mentor. And you must have the experience that you compare your mentor with others. â€œYour mentor seems better than mine.â€ Or â€œI think my mentor didnâ€™t teach me anything.â€ Do you care whether your mentor really teach you something or not? Yes, I think everyone cares. And have you ever thought about: What is the first thing come to your mind when talking about your mentor? I am not always a good mentee in my life, but I would like to share you some stories.
